Comments/Defaults: Images before processing are recorded in this file format. Select this format to process images on a computer for professional purposes. Sets the file format for still images.
Sets the file format for still images.
Sets the file format for still images.
Selects the file type for RAW images.

Since the compression rate increases from [Extra fine] to [Fine] to [Standard], the file size decreases in the same order. This allows more files to be recorded on one memory card, but the image quality is lower. Selects the JPEG image quality for [RAW & JPEG] or [JPEG] under [ File Format]. JPEG Image Size Selects the size of still images.
Selects the size of still images.
Same aspect ratio as 35 mm plate film Selects the aspect ratio for still images.
An aspect ratio suitable for viewing on a TV that supports high definition
Foo Sets whether to record in
Sets whether to record in either an APS-C-equivalent size or Super 35mm-equivalent size when [Shooting] is set to [Manual]. (Off/On)

Activates noise reduction for the same duration that the shutter is open. When noise reduction is in progress, a message appears and you cannot take another picture. Select this to prioritize the image quality. Sets noise reduction processing for shots with a shutter speed of 1 second
Does not activate noise reduction. Select this to prioritize the timing of shooting.
Activates high ISO noise reduction normally. Sets noise reduction processing for high-sensitivity shooting.
Activates high ISO noise reduction moderately.
Does not activate high ISO noise reduction. Select this to prioritize the timing of shooting.

This is the standard color space of the digital camera. Use [sRGB] in normal shooting, such as when you intend to print out the images without any modification. Changes the color space (range of reproducible colors).
This color space has a wide range of color reproduction. When a large part of the subject is vivid green or red, Adobe RGB is effective. The file name of the recorded image starts with “_.”
Sets whether to automatically compensate for darkness in the corners of the screen. ([Auto]/[Off]) Selects the type of lens compensation.
Sets whether to automatically reduce  color deviation at the corners of the screen. ([Auto]/[Off])
Sets whether to automatically compensate for distortion of the screen. ([Auto]/[Off])
Blurs background and sharpens the subject. Accentuates the skin tones softly. Selects pre-set settings to match various scene conditions.
Shoots a moving subject at a fast shutter speed so that the subject looks as if it is standing still. The product shoots images continuously while the shutter button is pressed.
Shoots close-ups of the subjects, such as flowers, insects, food, or small items.
Shoots the entire range of a scenery in sharp focus with vivid colors.
Shoots the red of the sunset beautifully.
Shoots night scenes without losing the dark atmosphere.
Shoots night scene portraits using the flash (sold separately).
Normal shooting mode. Sets the drive mode, such as for continuous shooting. ([Self-timer] / [Cont. Bracket], etc.)
Shoots images continuously while you press and hold down the shutter button.
Shoots an image using the self-timer after a designated number of seconds have elapsed since the shutter button was pressed.
Shoots a designated number of images using the self-timer after a designated number of seconds have elapsed since the shutter button was pressed.
Shoots images while holding the shutter button down, each with different degrees of exposure.
Shoots a specified number of images, one by one, each with a different degrees of exposure.
Shoots a total of three images, each with different color tones according to the selected settings for white balance, color temperature and color filter.
Shoots a total of three images, each at a different degree of D-Range Optimizer.

Sets whether to use the self-timer during bracket shooting. Also sets the number of seconds until the shutter is released if using the self-timer. (OFF/2 Sec/5 Sec/10 Sec) Sets self-timer shooting in bracket mode, shooting order for exposure
Sets the order of exposure bracketing and white balance bracketing. (0→-→+/-→0→+)
Selects the slot 1. Selects the memory card slot from which settings are recalled or to which
Selects the slot 2.
Sets whether to perform interval shooting. ([On]/[Off])
Sets the time from when you press the shutter button to when interval shooting starts. (1 second to 99 minutes 59 seconds)
Sets the shooting interval (time from when one exposure starts to when the exposure for the next shot starts). (1 second to 60 seconds)
Sets the number of shots for interval shooting. (1 shot to 9999 shots)

Sets the tracking sensitivity of the auto exposure against the change in luminance during interval shooting. If you select [Low], exposure changes during interval shooting will be smoother. ([High]/[Mid]/[Low])
Sets whether or not to perform silent shooting during interval shooting. ([On]/[Off])

Sets whether or not to prioritize the shooting interval when the exposure mode is [Program Auto] or [Aperture Priority] and the shutter speed becomes longer than the time set for [Shooting Interval]. ([On]/[Off])
Selects the focus mode. ([Single-shot AF] / [Continuous AF], etc.)
Prioritizes focusing. The shutter will not be released until the subject is in focus. Sets the timing of the shutter release when [Focus Mode] is
Prioritizes the shutter's release. The shutter will be released even if the subject is out of focus.
Shoots with a balanced emphasis on both focusing and shutter release.
Prioritizes focusing. The shutter will not be released until the subject is in focus. Sets the timing of the shutter release when [Focus Mode] is set to
Prioritizes the shutter's release. The shutter will be released even if the subject is out of focus.
Shoots with a balanced emphasis on both focusing and shutter release.

Focuses on a subject covering the whole range of the screen automatically.  When you press the shutter button halfway down in the still image shooting mode, a green frame is displayed around the area that is in focus. Selects the area of focus.
Select a zone on the monitor on which to focus, and the product will automatically select a focus area.
Focuses automatically on a subject in the center of the image. Use together with the focus-lock function to create the composition you want.
Allows you to move the focusing frame to a desired point on the screen and focus on an extremely small subject in a narrow area.
If the product cannot focus on a single selected point, it uses focus points around the flexible spot as a secondary priority area for focusing.

When the shutter button is pressed and held halfway down, the product tracks the subject within the selected autofocus area.  This setting is available only when the [Focus Mode] is set to [Continuous AF]. Point the cursor at [Lock-on AF] on the [Focus Area] setting screen, and then select the desired area to start tracking using the left/right sides of the control wheel. You can also move the tracking start area to the desired point by designating the area as a zone, flexible spot or expand flexible spot.
Allows you to focus using the front dial, rear dial or control wheel.

Does not switch the [Focus Area] and the position of the focusing frame according to the orientation of the camera (horizontal/vertical). Sets whether to adjust the [Focus Area] and the position of the
Switches the position of the focusing frame according to the orientation of the camera (horizontal/vertical). The [Focus Area] is fixed.
Switches both the [Focus Area] and the position of the focusing frame according to the orientation of the camera (horizontal/vertical).
The AF illuminator lights up automatically in dark surroundings. Sets the AF illuminator, which provides light to aid focusing in dark
Does not use the AF illuminator.
Sets the function to track a subject and continue focusing when pressing
Sets whether the camera focuses based on detected faces.

Select [5(Responsive)] to focus responsively on subjects at different distances.  Select [1(Locked on)] to keep the focus on a specific subject when other things are crossing in front of the subject. Sets the AF tracking sensitivity for the still image mode.
Focuses with Phase Detection AF. The focusing speed is very fast. Sets the auto focus method when an LA-EA1/LA-EA3 Mount Adaptor
Always focuses with Contrast AF. The focusing speed is slower. Use when you cannot focus with [Phase Detection AF].
The auto focus operates when you press the shutter button halfway down. Sets whether to perform auto focusing when the shutter button is
The auto focus does not operate even if you press the shutter button halfway down.
Adjusts focus before you press the shutter button halfway down. Sets whether or not to perform auto focus before the shutter button is half
Does not adjust focus before you press the shutter button halfway down.
Sets whether to use auto focus when you look through the viewfinder if
Sets whether to move the focusing frame to a preassigned position when
Deletes the focusing frame position information that was registered using
The focus area disappears automatically shortly after focus is achieved. Sets whether the focus area is displayed all the time or disappears
The focus area is displayed all the time.
Displays the focus area that is in focus. Sets whether or not to display the focus area in [Continuous AF] mode.
Does not display the focus area that is in focus.
adjusts the autofocused position, when using the LA-EA2
Uses the standard aperture drive system.
Changes the aperture drive system to prioritize silence so that the sound from the aperture drive is quieter than in [Standard].
Compensates for the brightness of the entire image.
Maintains the settings. Sets whether to maintain the exposure value set using
Resets the settings.
Sets the ISO sensitivity automatically. Sets the ISO sensitivity. ([ISO AUTO], etc.)
Sets the ISO sensitivity manually. Selecting a larger number increases the ISO sensitivity.

The ISO sensitivity will start to change at shutter speeds faster than [Standard], so you can prevent camera shake and subject blurring. Sets the slowest shutter speed at which ISO sensitivity will start to
The camera automatically sets the shutter speed based on the focal length of the lens.
The ISO sensitivity will start to change at shutter speeds slower than [Standard], so you can shoot images with less noise.

Comments/Defaults: Exposure1 Metering Mode Multi Measures light on each area after dividing the total area into multiple areas and determines the proper exposure of the entire screen (Multi-pattern metering). Selects the method for measuring brightness.
Measures the average brightness of the entire screen, while emphasizing the central area of the screen (Center-weighted metering).

Measures only the central area (Spot metering). This mode is suitable for measuring light on a specified part of the entire screen. The size of the metering circle can be selected from [Spot: Standard] and [Spot: Large]. The position of the metering circle depends the setting for [Spot Metering Point].
Measures the average brightness of the entire screen. The exposure will be stable even if the composition or the position of the subject changes.
Measures the brightness while emphasizing the highlighted area on the screen. This mode is suitable for shooting the subject while avoiding overexposure.
The camera measures brightness based on detected faces. Sets whether the camera measures brightness based on detected faces
The camera measures brightness using the [Multi] setting, without detecting faces.
The spot metering position does not coordinate with the focus area, but always meters brightness at the center. Sets whether to coordinate the spot metering point with the
The spot metering position coordinates with the focus area.
Selects the size of the increment step for shutter speed, aperture, and

Fixes the exposure after adjusting the focus automatically when you press the shutter button halfway down when [Focus Mode] is set to [Single-shot AF]. When [Focus Mode] is set to [Automatic AF], and the product determines that the subject is moving, or you shoot burst images, the fixed exposure is cancelled. Sets whether to lock the exposure when the shutter button is pressed
Fixes the exposure when you press the shutter button halfway down.

Does not fix the exposure when you press the shutter button halfway down. Use this mode when you want to adjust focus and exposure separately.  The product keeps adjusting the exposure while shooting in [Cont. Shooting] mode.
Adjusts the standard for the correct exposure value for each metering
The flash does not operate. Sets the flash settings.
The flash works in dark environments or when shooting towards bright light.
The flash works every time you trigger the shutter.
The flash works every time you trigger the shutter. Slow sync shooting allows you to shoot a clear image of both the subject and the background by slowing the shutter speed.

The flash works right before the exposure is completed every time you trigger the shutter. Rear sync shooting allows you to shoot a natural image of the trail of a moving subject such as a moving car or a walking person.
Adjusts the intensity of flash output.
Sets whether to reflect exposure compensation value to flash
Does not use the wireless flash function. Sets whether to shoot with the wireless flash.
Uses the wireless flash function to make an external flash or flashes emit light at a distance from the camera.
The flash is always fired to reduce the red-eye phenomenon. Reduces the red-eye phenomenon when using flash.
Does not use Red Eye Reduction.
Allows you to configure settings related to the firing of the flash, such as the flash mode, flash level, etc.
Allows you to configure other flash settings, wireless settings, and flash unit settings.
Corrects the tone effect of the ambient light to shoot whitish objects
Shoots with standard auto white balance. The camera automatically adjusts the color tones. Selects which tone to prioritize when shooting under lighting conditions
Prioritizes the color tone of the light source. This is suitable when you want to produce a warm atmosphere.
Prioritizes a reproduction of white color when the color temperature of the light source is low.
Corrects the brightness automatically. Analyzes the contrast of light and shadow between the subject and the

Sub Menu Item: Auto HDR: Exposure Diff. 1.0EV ― Auto HDR: Exposure Diff. 6.0EV
Comments/Defaults: Sets the exposure difference, based on the contrast of the subject. Select the optimization level from 1.0EV (weak) to 6.0EV (strong).  For example, if you set the exposure value to 2.0 EV, three images will be composed with the following exposure levels: -1.0 EV, correct exposure and +1.0 EV.
For shooting various scenes with rich gradation and beautiful colors. Selects the desired image processing.
The saturation and contrast are heightened for shooting striking images of colorful scenes and subjects such as flowers, spring greenery, blue sky, or ocean views.
The saturation and sharpness are lowered for shooting images in subdued tones. This is also suitable for capturing image material to be modified with a computer.
For shooting images in clear tones with limpid colors in highlight, suitable for capturing radiant light.
For shooting images with deep and dense colors, suitable for capturing the solid presence of the subject.
For shooting images with bright and simple colors, suitable for capturing a refreshingly light ambience.
For capturing skin in a soft tone, ideally suited for shooting portraits.
The saturation, contrast, and sharpness are heightened for shooting vivid and crisp scenery. Distant landscapes also stand out more.
For shooting the beautiful red of the setting sun.
The contrast is lowered for reproducing night scenes.
For shooting autumn scenes, vividly highlighting the reds and yellows of changing leaves.
For shooting images in black and white monotone.
For shooting images in sepia monotone.

Select the six style box (the boxes with numbers on the left side ()) to register preferred settings. Then select the desired settings using the right button.  You can call up the same style with slightly different settings.
The higher the value selected, the more the difference of light and shadow is accentuated, and the bigger the effect on the image.
The higher the value selected, the more vivid the color. When a lower value is selected, the color of the image is restrained and subdued.
Adjusts the sharpness. The higher the value selected, the more the contours are accentuated, and the lower the value selected, the more the contours are softened.
Disables the [Picture Effect] function. Shoots images with a texture unique to the selected effect.
Creates a soft image with shaded corners and reduced sharpness.
Creates a vivid look by emphasizing color tones.
Creates a high contrast, abstract look by heavily emphasizing primary colors, or in black and white.
Creates the look of an aged photo with sepia color tones and faded contrast.
Creates an image with the indicated atmosphere: bright, transparent, ethereal, tender, soft.
Creates an image which retains a specific color, but converts others to black and white.
Creates a high-contrast image in black and white.
Creates an image in black and white with rich gradation and reproduction of details.
Example setting using [Movie] gamma. Changes settings such as color and tone when recording images.
Example setting using [Still] gamma.
Example setting of natural color tone using the [ITU709] gamma.
Example setting of a color tone faithful to the ITU709 standard.
Example setting using [Cine1] gamma.
Example setting using [Cine2] gamma.
Example setting using [S-Log2] gamma.
Example setting using the [S-Log3] gamma and the [S-Gamut3.Cine] under [Color Mode].
Example setting using the [S-Log3] gamma and the [S-Gamut3] under [Color Mode].
Example setting for recording HDR movies using [HLG2] gamma.
Sets the black level. (–15 to +15)
Selects a gamma curve.
Corrects gamma in low intensity areas.

Sets knee point and slope for video signal compression to prevent over-exposure by limiting signals in high intensity areas of the subject to the dynamic range of your camera. [Knee] is disabled if [Mode] is set to [Auto] when [Gamma] is set to [Still], [Cine1], [Cine2], [Cine3], [Cine4], [ITU709(800%)], [S-Log2], [S-Log3], [HLG], [HLG1], [HLG2], or [HLG3]. To enable [Knee], set [Mode] to [Manual].
Sets type and level of colors. In [Color Mode], only [BT.2020] and [709] are available when [Gamma] is set to [HLG], [HLG1], [HLG2], or [HLG3].
Sets the color saturation. (-32 to +32)
Sets the color phase. (-7 to +7)

Sets the color depth for each color phase. This function is more effective for chromatic colors and less effective for achromatic colors.  The color looks deeper as you increase the setting value towards the positive side, and lighter as you decrease the value towards the negative side. This function is effective even if you set [Color Mode] to [Black & White].
Sets items for [Detail].

Sub Menu Item: To copy the settings to another picture profile number
Comments/Defaults: You can copy the settings of the picture profile to another picture profile number.

Sub Menu Item: To Reset the picture profile to the default setting
Comments/Defaults: You can reset the picture profile to the default setting. You cannot reset all picture profile settings at once.
Enlarges the image before shooting so that you can check the focus.
Magnifies the images for 2 seconds. Sets the length of time the image will be shown in an enlarged form.
Magnifies the images for 5 seconds.
Magnifies the images until you press the shutter button.
Displays the image with the same magnification as the shooting screen. Sets the initial magnification scale when using [Focus Magnifier].
Displays a 5.9-times enlarged image.
Displays the image with the same magnification as the shooting screen.
Displays a 3.8-times enlarged image.
Sets whether or not to autofocus when an enlarged image is being
Displays an enlarged image when focusing manually.
Sets whether to display peaking. Sets the peaking function, which enhances the outline of in-focus areas
Sets the level of enhancement of in-focus areas.
Sets the color used to enhance in-focus areas.
Does not reduce influences caused by flickering. Detects flickering/blinking from artificial light sources such as
Reduces influences caused by flickering. When the camera detects flickering while the shutter button is pressed halfway down,  (flicker icon) will be displayed.
changes the person to be given priority when focusing.
Focuses with higher priority on faces registered using [Face Registration]. Detects the registered face with higher priority using
Focuses without giving higher priority to  registered faces.
Allows you to shoot with the exposure adjusted automatically (both the shutter speed and the aperture value). Sets the exposure mode when shooting movies.
Allows you to shoot after adjusting the aperture value manually.
Allows you to shoot after adjusting the shutter speed manually.
Allows you to shoot after adjusting the exposure (both the shutter speed and the aperture value) manually.
Sets the exposure mode when shooting movies.
Sets the file format for still images.
Selects a frame-rate and bit-rate for the movie.
Selects the frame rate of the movie. Changes the settings for slow-motion and quick-motion movie shooting.
Selects the shooting frame rate.
Proxy movies are simultaneously recorded. Records low-bit-rate proxy files simultaneously when recording
Proxy movies are not recorded.
Sets the AF drive speed to fast. This mode is suitable for shooting active scenes, such as sports. Switches focusing speed when using autofocus in movie mode.
Sets the AF drive speed to normal.
Sets the AF drive speed to slow. With this mode, the focus switches smoothly when the subject to be focused is changed.
Sets the AF tracking sensitivity for the still image mode.

Uses Auto Slow Shutter. The shutter speed automatically slows when recording in dark locations. You can reduce noise in the movie by using a slow shutter speed when recording in dark locations. Sets the function that automatically adjusts the shutter speed following
Does not use Auto Slow Shutter. The recorded movie will be darker than when [On] is selected, but you can record movies with smoother motion and less object blur.
Records sound (stereo). Sets whether to record audio when shooting a movie.
Does not record sound.
Turns up the audio recording level. Adjusts the audio recording level during movie recording.
Turns down the audio recording level.
Resets the audio recording level to the default setting.
Displays the audio level. Sets whether to display the audio level.
Does not display the audio level.
Outputs audio without delay. Select this setting when audio deviation is a problem during audio monitoring. Sets the timing of audio output during the movie recording.
Outputs audio and video in sync. Select this setting to prevent undesirable deviations between video and audio.
Reduces wind noise. Reduces wind noise during movie recording.
Does not reduce wind noise.
Markers are displayed. The markers are not recorded. Sets whether to display markers on the monitor when recording movies.
No marker is displayed.
Sets whether or not to display the center marker in the center of the shooting screen.   [Off]/[On] Sets which markers to display on the monitor when recording movies.
Sets the safety zone display. This becomes the standard range that can be received by a general household TV. [Off]/[80%]/[90%]
Sets whether or not to display the guide frame. You can verify whether the subject is level or perpendicular to the ground. [Off]/[On]
The video light turns on/off in sync with the ON/OFF operation of this camera. Sets the illumination setting for the
The video light turns on/off in sync with movie recording start/stop.
The video light turns on when movie recording starts and dims when not recording (STBY).
The video light automatically turns on when it is dark.
Enables movie recording using the shutter button when the shooting mode is set to [Movie] or [S&Q Motion]. Records movies using the shutter button.
Disables movie recording using the shutter button.
You can shoot images without the shutter sound. Shoots images without the shutter sound.
[Silent Shooting] is deactivated.
Uses the electronic front curtain shutter function.
Does not use the electronic front curtain shutter function.
Releases the shutter when no lens is attached. Select [Enable] when attaching the product to an astronomical telescope, etc. Sets whether to release the shutter when the lens is not attached.
Does not release the shutter when a lens is not attached.
Releases the shutter even if no memory card has been inserted. Sets whether to release the shutter when a memory card is not inserted.
Does not release the shutter when no memory card has been inserted.
Uses [SteadyShot]. Sets whether to activate SteadyShot for shooting.
Does not use [SteadyShot].  We recommend that you set [Off] when using a tripod, etc.
Performs the SteadyShot function automatically according to the information obtained from the attached lens. Sets SteadyShot settings.
Performs the SteadyShot function according to the focal-length set using [SteadyS. Focal Len.]. (8mm-1000mm) Check the focal-length index (A) and set the focal-length.
Sets the zoom scale for zoom functions other than the optical zoom.
Limits the zoom range to the optical zoom. You can use the Smart Zoom function if you set [JPEG Image Size] to [M] or [S]. Sets whether to use the Clear Image
Select this setting to use Clear Image Zoom. Even if the zoom range exceeds the optical zoom, the product magnifies images within the range in which image quality does not deteriorate significantly.
When the zoom range of the Clear Image Zoom is exceeded, the product magnifies images to the largest scale. However, the image quality will deteriorate.
Assigns zoom out (W) function to left-handed rotation and zoom-in (T) function to right-handed rotation. Assigns the zoom in/out to the rotational direction of the zoom lens.

Sets whether to display the zebra pattern. Sets the stripes displayed to adjust brightness.
Adjusts the brightness level of the zebra pattern.
Place main subjects close to one of the grid lines that divide the image into thirds for a well-balanced composition. Displays grid lines for adjusting the image composition.
Square grids make it easier to confirm the horizontal level of your composition. This is suitable to determine the quality of the composition when shooting landscape, close-up, or duplicated images.
Place a subject on the diagonal line to express an uplifting and powerful feeling.
Does not display the grid line.
Does not display the guide. Sets the guide displayed when exposure settings are changed in the
Displays the guide.

Displays Live View in conditions close to what your picture will look like as a result of applying all your settings. Displays Live View without the effects of exposure compensation, white balance, [Creative Style], or [Picture Effect].  When this setting is used, you can easily check the image composition.  Live View is always displayed with the appropriate brightness even in [Manual Exposure] mode. When [Setting Effect OFF] is selected, the  icon is displayed on the Live View screen.
Always displays the indicator when the drive mode is set to [Cont. Shooting]. Sets whether to display an indicator continuous shooting can be performed at the same shooting speed.

Displays the recorded image on the screen right after shooting for the selected duration of time.  If you perform a magnifying operation during Auto Review, you can check that image using the magnified scale. Sets auto review to display the captured image after shooting.

Sounds are produced for example when the focus is achieved by pressing the shutter button halfway down. Selects whether the camera beeps during auto focus and self-timer

Applies or cancels the protection of the selected multiple images.

Selects images to order printing. (1) Select an image and press the center of the control wheel. The  mark is displayed in the check box. Select [On], in which images are played back in a continuous loop, or [Off], in which the product exits the slideshow when all the images are played back once. Plays a slide show.
Select the display interval for images from among [1 Sec], [3 Sec], [5 Sec], [10 Sec] or [30 Sec].
Selects the slot 1. Selects the memory card slot of the memory card to be played back.
Selects the slot 2.
Displays the images by date. Plays back images from a specified date or specified folder of still images
Displays only still images.
Displays only AVCHD-format movies.
Displays only XAVC S HD-format movies.
Displays only XAVC S 4K-format movies.
Displays multiple images at the same time.
Displays images as a group.

When you rotate the camera, the displayed image rotates automatically by detecting the orientation of the camera. Sets the playback orientation for images shot vertically.
Images shot vertically are displayed vertically. If you have set the image orientation using the [Rotate] function, the image will be displayed accordingly.
Images are always displayed horizontally.
Selects the dial to use for jumping between images. Sets which dial and method to use for jumping between images during
Sets the type of images to be played back with Image Jump.
Adjusts the brightness within the range of –2 to +2. Adjusts the brightness of the screen.
Sets the brightness appropriately for shooting outdoors.
Adjusts the brightness automatically. Sets the brightness of the electronic viewfinder.
When you select “-,” the viewfinder screen changes to a warmer color, and when you select “+,” it changes to a colder color. Sets the color temperature of the viewfinder.
Does not apply [Gamma Disp. Assist]. Adjusts the screen to make monitoring easier when displaying an

Displays movies with an [S-Log2→709(800%)] effect when the gamma set in [Picture Profile] is [S-Log2], and with an [S-Log3→709(800%)] effect when the gamma is set to [S-Log3]. Displays movies with an [HLG(BT.2020)] effect when the gamma set in [Picture Profile] is [HLG], [HLG1], [HLG2] or [HLG3], and [Color Mode] is set to [BT.2020].  Displays movies with an [HLG(709)] effect when the gamma set in [Picture Profile] is [HLG], [HLG1], [HLG2] or [HLG3], and [Color Mode] is set to [709].
Displays movies with an S-Log2 gamma reproducing contrast equivalent to ITU709 (800%).
Displays movies with an S-Log3 gamma reproducing contrast equivalent to ITU709 (800%).
Displays movies after adjusting the image quality of the monitor or viewfinder to a quality that is almost the same as when movies are displayed on an [HLG(BT.2020)] compatible monitor.
Displays movies after adjusting the image quality of the monitor or viewfinder to a quality that is almost the same as when movies are displayed on an [HLG(709)] compatible monitor.
Sets the volume for movie playback.
Sets whether [Delete] or [Cancel] is preselected in the delete confirmation
Sets the display quality. * When [High] is selected, the battery
Sets the time intervals to automatically switch to power save
Sets the standard temperature for the camera to turn off. Sets the camera temperature at which the camera turns off automatically
Sets the temperature at which the camera turns off to higher than [Standard].
Continuous recording time for movies (HD): Approx. 29 minutes
Continuous recording time for movies (HD): Approx. 29 minutes
Continuous recording time for movies (HD): Approx. 29 minutes
Starts the cleaning mode to clean the image sensor.

Activates the touch operation. Sets whether or not to activate the touch operation of the monitor. 72 73 Touch Panel/Pad Selects whether to activate touch panel operation when shooting with the monitor, or touch pad operation when shooting with the viewfinder.
Deactivates the touch operation.

Activates both the touch panel operations when shooting with the monitor and touch pad operations when shooting with the viewfinder. Selects whether to activate touch panel operation when shooting with the monitor, or touch pad operation when shooting with the viewfinder.
Activates only the touch panel operations when shooting with the monitor.
Activates only the touch pad operations when shooting with the viewfinder.

Sets whether to enable touch pad operations during  vertically oriented viewfinder shooting. You can prevent erroneous operations during vertically oriented shooting caused by your nose, etc. touching the monitor. Adjusts settings related to touch pad operation.

Sets whether to move the focusing frame to the position touched on the screen ([Absolute Position]), or move the focusing frame to the desired position based on the direction of dragging and the amount of movement ([Relative Position]).
Sets the area to be used for touch pad operations. Restricting the operational area can prevent erroneous operations caused by your nose, etc. touching the monitor.

The movie playback demonstration starts automatically if the product is not operated for about one minute. Only protected AVCHD movies can be played back.  Set the view mode to [AVCHD View], and protect the movie file with the oldest recorded date and time. Sets demonstration playback of movies to on or off.
Does not show the demonstration.
Sets the display for the counter, time code, and user bit. Sets the time code (TC) and user bit (UB).
Sets the time code.
Sets the user bit.
Sets the recording method for the time code. (Only when [NTSC/PAL Selector] is set to NTSC.)
Sets the count up format for the time code.
Sets the recording format for the time code on the recording medium.
Sets whether or not to record the time as a user bit.
Records the time code in Drop Frame*2 format.
Records the time code in Non-Drop Frame format.
Sets the stepping mode for the time code to advance only while recording. The time code is recorded sequentially from the last time code of the previous recording.
Sets the stepping mode for the time code to advance anytime, regardless of the camera operation.
Records the newly set time code on the recording medium.

Reads the last time code for the previous recording from the recording medium and records the new time code consecutively from the last time code. The time code is read from the memory card in the slot 1 when [Recording Mode] under [Rec. Media Settings] is set to [Simult. ()] or [Simult. (/)]. The time code is read from the memory card to which the movies will be recorded when [Recording Mode] is set to [Standard], [Simult. ()], [Sort(RAW/JPEG)], [Sort(JPEG/RAW)] or [Sort(/)]. The time code advances in [Rec Run] mode regardless of the [TC Run] setting.
Allows infrared remote commander operation. Sets whether to use the infrared remote control.
Does not allow infrared remote commander operation.

Outputs signals in 2160p/1080p.
Outputs signals in HD picture quality (1080p).
Outputs signals in HD picture quality (1080i).
Simultaneously outputs to the external recording/playback device and records on the camera’s memory card.
Outputs a 4K movie in 30p to the external recording/playback device without recording on the camera’s memory card.
Outputs a 4K movie in 24p to the external recording/playback device without recording on the camera’s memory card.
Outputs a 4K movie in 25p to the external recording/playback device without recording on the camera’s memory card.
Establishes a Mass Storage or MTP connection automatically, depending on the computer or other USB devices to be connected. Sets the USB connection method.
Establishes a Mass Storage connection between this product, a computer, and other USB devices.
Establishes an MTP connection between this product, a computer, and other USB devices. The memory card in memory card slot 1 is the connection target.
Uses Imaging Edge to control the product from a computer, including such functions as shooting and storing images on the computer.
Power is supplied to the product via a USB cable when the product is connected to a computer, etc. Sets whether to supply power via
Power is not supplied to the product via a USB cable when the product is connected to a computer, etc. If you use an AC adaptor, power will be supplied even when [Off] is selected.
Saves still images only on the computer. Controls the PC remote shooting settings.
Saves still images on the computer and the camera.

Sets the date, time, and daylight savings.
Sets the location of use.
